page.title: 05Castlemorton - Village
page.content: The village of{Castlemorton}lies surrounded by common land to the South East of the Malvern Hills. The housing within varies from 17c half timbered cottages through to modern red brick houses, mainly spread along the main road of the village. It contains a church, post office and general store, and a primary school with 4O pupils. The community hall lies outside the main boundaries of the village and is also used by the neighbouring parish. The main occupation of the villagers is mixed agriculture but many commute to business in the towns around. A number of householders offer bed and breakfast and three caravan club listed sites are available for visitors. Strict building regulations mean that the village is not expected to grow in the forseeable future.
